meanings.definition: A shrub with small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The chamise in the garden bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent2: I saw a chamise bush with delicate white flowers on my hike.
meanings.sent3: The chamise whispered secrets to the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The chamise stood out like a bride in a field of green bridesmaids.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of chamise filled the air, inviting bees and butterflies.

meanings.definition: To clear land by cutting down shrubs.
meanings.sent1: We need to chamise this area before we can start building.
meanings.sent2: The workers will chamise the overgrown land to make way for the new road.
meanings.sent3: He chamised the bushes with determination, making quick work of the task.
meanings.sent4: The team chamised the area like a well-oiled machine, clearing the land in record time.
meanings.sent5: Chamising the shrubs revealed a hidden path through the forest, much to their surprise.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric made from cotton or linen.
meanings.sent1: She wore a lovely chamise dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The soft chamise fabric felt cool against her skin on the hot day.
meanings.sent3: The chamise cloth fluttered in the breeze like a gentle cloud.
meanings.sent4: The chamise material draped elegantly, enhancing her natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The chamise garment was so comfortable, she never wanted to take it off.
